extendedInfo.description: This is a LITE version of The Michael Morcombe eGuide to the Birds of Australia but is fully functional and includes ONLY 59 species, compared to over 790 species in the full app. If you like the way this app works please check out the full version.NB: Please note that an additional download of 31MB is required once this app has been installed. Please ensure you use a WiFi connection to prevent additional data costs.The foremost field guide to Australian birds is now available on the Android.Michael Morcombe's Field Guide to Australian Birds has been called the most comprehensive field guide to Australian birds in the market today and now it is perfectly complimented by the eGuide which features:â Optimised controls â swipe to next or previous species, one-tap enlargement of an image and rotate the device (landscape) to enlarge an image completely (and fit the width of the screen).â Over 230 hi-res bird images covering 59 bird species.â Most bird species have a detailed distribution map showing any subspecies that occur.â Detailed text descriptions of almost all bird species including songs and calls, measurements and breeding behaviour.â Over 170 carefully-selected and edited sound recordings. Many species are represented with multiple call examples showing the full range of vocalizations.â The ability to compare any two images, maps, or sounds, side by side on the screen.â The ability to filter by geographic location, so that you see only the species likely to occur in your location, and to further reduce the possibilities to usual or vagrant species in the selected area.â A "Smart Search" that gives the ability to search by distinguishing features such as size, colour, physical features, habitat and exclude certain types of birds (eg. Passerines).â *A basic personal species list that stores your sightings saved to the device (ability to upload list coming soon)â A comprehensive help and introduction section to help you if you get stuck or donât understand how a certain feature works.* Uninstalling/reinstalling the program will result in the loss of your list, it is recommended that you keep a backup from the application (My List -> Export).We invite all users to share their comments and ideas on our forum at www.mydigitalearth.com

reviews.title: Works great BUT then full version not compatible
reviews.comment: Not sure what the point is of getting the \'Lite\' App when it works great but when one tries to download the FULL version the App refuses to download saying \'device is incompatible\'.  I would think you would design both the trial and full version to work on same devices as we cough the table device based on the \'lite\' one working and now being unable to install the App made it all a waste of money :-(
reviews.author: Jelena Dakic

reviews.title: Excellent - except for price of full version
reviews.comment: A very impressive app (as is the book which I have). But price it at less than $10 and you will sell many more. Shame about the difficulty for people of downloading the mass of data required, but hard to solve that problem - can do via PC.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Great pics and descriptions. Listen to several bird calls for each species. Set location to search only local birds. Enough common birds here to learn before I install the full version. Better than a field guide book.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Impressive but too expensive
reviews.comment: I\'d gladly purchase the full version if it was a little less expensive. I understand the amount of work that went into the app, it shows, but you can get bird guide books with more info for less. I think more profit could be made with a reduced price as a higher volume of people would buy it. Maybe the price of a bird guide book, $15-$20?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: is it the world\'s most expensive app? must be!  by the way the demo version do not work....   waste of time
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: My Pick, But...
reviews.comment: I would love to purchase the full Morcomebe\'s Birds of Aus.  It is beautiful!. The problem is, I cant spend nearly $30 here, and so must pass it up for a lesser \"freebie\"..  IF Morcomebes were to drop the price to $15 or less, this GEM of a Bird reference would sell in huge numbers, instead of languishing on the shelf. How about it?
reviews.author: Charles Bassett

reviews.title: Crap!! will unstall
reviews.comment: Downloaded the lite version to check it out. Not possible to download the necessary files from Earthlink. Numerous tries but keeps disconnecting half way through. Certainly wouldn\'t pay the money for the full one if I cant get the files.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work
reviews.comment: In the lite version, a search for \'green\',  \'parrot like\' birds in SE Australia returns no birds.  Not very helpful.
reviews.author: Tim Brown

reviews.title: Froze phone!
reviews.comment: Useless unfortunately. Did nothing but freeze my phone. Turned off, rebooted, still doesn\'t work.
reviews.author: Steph Hagger
